commitResults.messageTitle: Support simple name-only format in AddCommandParser
commitResults.messageBody:
- AddCommandParser now accepts input with only the n/ prefix, creating a Company with placeholder values for phone, email, and address
- Improves usability for cases where only a name is provided.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update AddCommand usage message with examples
commitResults.messageBody: Enhanced the MESSAGE_USAGE string in AddCommand to include both simple and detailed formats

commitResults.messageTitle: Add tests for company placeholder values in AddCommand
commitResults.messageBody: Added tests to verify AddCommand behavior when adding companies with placeholder values and handling duplicates. Also added parser tests for simple name format, invalid names, and duplicate name prefixes.

New Test Methods Added

  Execute Method Tests:
  1. execute_companyWithMultipleTags_addSuccessful() - Tests adding a company with multiple tags (client, partner, supplier)
  2. execute_companyWithNoTags_addSuccessful() - Tests adding a company without any tags
  3. execute_companyWithNumbersInName_addSuccessful() - Tests adding a company with alphanumeric name (e.g., "3M Corporation")
  4. execute_companyWithLongAddress_addSuccessful() - Tests adding a company with a very long address
  5. execute_nullModel_throwsNullPointerException() - Tests proper exception handling when model is null
  6. execute_multipleDifferentCompanies_addSuccessful() - Tests adding multiple different companies sequentially
  7. execute_duplicateCompanyAfterMultipleAdds_throwsCommandException() - Tests duplicate detection after multiple adds
  8. execute_companyWithDifferentNameCasing_notConsideredDuplicate() - Tests that case-sensitive names are treated as different
  companies

  CommandResult Validation Tests:

  9. execute_commandResultNotNull_success() - Verifies CommandResult is not null and has correct message
  10. execute_commandResultShowHelp_returnsFalse() - Verifies the command doesn't show help window
  11. execute_commandResultExit_returnsFalse() - Verifies the command doesn't exit application

commitResults.messageBody:
This PR enhances the edit command by introducing batch editing functionality, enabling users to update multiple companies’ tags in a single command. This improves the efficiency and usability of the CLI for managing internship applications.

New Feature

edit 1,2 t/applied → Updates the tags of companies 1 and 2 to applied.
Existing Behavior (Still Supported)

edit 1 t/ → Clears all tags for company 1.
edit 1 t/applied → Updates the tag for company 1 to applied.
Testing

Implemented automated unit tests to validate the correctness and reliability of the new batch editing functionality.
Added test coverage for various edge cases to ensure robust handling of invalid inputs.
Code Quality Improvements

Resolved Checkstyle violations across the modified files. (AI acknowledgement)
Renamed occurrences of NAME to COMPANY to better reflect the domain model.
Exception handling to throw and catch errors gracefully.
Future Enhancements To Consider:

edit t:applied t/interview → Edit all companies with specified tags.
edit c:google,meta t/interview → Edit specific companies by name.
edit * t/applied → Edit tags for all visible companies.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add status field to track application stage for companies
commitResults.messageBody:
Implement comprehensive status tracking system that allows users to monitor the stage of their internship applications. The status field supports alphanumeric values with hyphens (e.g., "technical-interview", "hr-interview") and defaults to "pending-application".

Changes include:
- New Status model class with validation
- StatusCommand and StatusCommandParser for updating status via CLI
- Integration into Company entity and related commands (Add, Edit, Remark)
- Updated storage layer (JsonAdaptedCompany) for persistence
- UI updates to display status in CompanyCard
- Comprehensive test coverage for new functionality
Now reflects the newly added Remark and Status commands in both User and Developer Guide
This reverts commit 108bdf7bddbec9597672c8992b5f46e83a83a9e7.

commitResults.messageTitle: Create Enums for Status, not in use yet. Still works with strings.
Enforce enums with 5 stages of application. Other statuses not accepted.
Enforce enums with 5 stages of application. Other statuses not accepted.

commitResults.messageBody:
Added:
1. OA
2. TECH_INTERVIEW
3. HR_INTERVIEW
4. ACCEPTED (to differentiate between offered and accepted)

IN_PROCESS will now be used as the stage after all middling stages are completed, while user is awaiting the company's offer/rejection.
